item.title: How to Find Deenah in Date Everything (Dateable 68)
item.description:
Date Everything is a quirky dating simulator that features over 100 Dateable characters. This isn't the typical dating simulator, as all the romance options are literally based on furniture. Thanks to a pair of technologically advanced sunglasses, players can see and interact with the personifications of their household possessions.

Almost every item in the house can be scanned with the Dateviators, but some are more obscure than others. Deenah is a unique character in Date Everything , and players may not find them where they are expecting. So, here's how to find Deenah and romance them.

How to Find Deenah in Date Everything

Dateable 68

Deenah is listed as Dateable 68 in Date Everything . After players finish the tutorial, they are free to explore every corner of their house. Their main objective is to discover all the eligible objects, form a relationship with them, and bring them back to life. There are three types of relationships players can form with Dateables:

  • Love
  • Friendship
  • Hate

Earning one of these relationship statuses results in players earning stat points towards one of their SPECS points. SPECS stands for Smarts, Poise, Empathy, Charm, and Sass. These are required for players to Realize objects and turn them into humans by completing their Realization Recipe.

Deenah is a special case in Date Everything , because her personality is based on what feels like an inside joke made by the devs. Talking to Deenah reveals a curious fact: they are a Dateable who didn't make the game's final cut. Players will first hear about Deenah if they ask Bedroom Dorian about the Dateables in the bedroom. He warns them that Deenah is a little odd, which is a slight understatement.

Players will find Deenah by scanning the dresser in their bedroom. Usually, a Dateable appears when players scan, but in Deenah's case, all they get is a message that seems to be a bunch of keyboard smashing. A similar occurrence takes place the next time they scan them. It isn't until players scan the dresser for a third time that they make progress with the Dateable, and they are added to the Date-A-Dex. Deenah appears as Daemon, a flickering, data-based humanoid that looks like something out of Cyberpunk .

Socializing with Deenah/Daemon is different from socializing with other Dateables. There are no positive or negative responses, as everything is word fragments or repeated clicking. Players will also get the "New Dateable Added" message three times. Then, they can decide on the relationship status they want with Deenah/Daemon and will automatically earn SPECS points towards the Smarts stat. Their dresser starts flickering and looking unstable from that point on. If players keep interacting with Deenah/Daemon, they'll get a few more mildly frustrating and glitchy interactions. They can also change their relationship status with Deenah/Daemon at any point once a day.

If they trigger the Hate relationship with Deenah, they can prompt Reggie to appear. Reggie is another Dateable who appears if players get rejected.

Overall, finding and dating Deenah isn't the most romantic Dateable in Date Everything . However, players can still take advantage of the free SPECS points and enjoy some punny conversation that is only slightly infuriating.

8 Images
8 Images
Date Everything!
9.3 /10
Released
June 17, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol, Strong Language

item.title: Should You Pick the Big or Little Basket in Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma?
item.description:
Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma has many optional side quests to complete in addition to its main story, which you might stumble across randomly when exploring Azuma. Roll, Roll, Roll Your Onigiri is one such Azuma side quest in Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma that sees you feed Onigiri recipes to a mysterious hole in the ground. Doing so gives you some player-chosen rewards inside a big basket or little basket, with six Onigiri hole spots to feed. Consequently, you might wonder if you should choose the big basket or little basket in Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma , and what reward you get with each choice.

This guide details all the rewards you get for choosing the big or little basket in Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma 's Roll, Roll, Roll Your Onigiri , its six quest locations, and the various Onigiri recipes you must choose to satisfy the hole's strange inhabitants in this quirky quest. While it could be an ideal post-game activity, it's also a quest that's best attempted once you've at least unlocked all the Sacred Treasures in the game, specifically the Sacred Staff and Sacred Parosol, which you will need to reach some of the quest locations.

How To Start Roll, Roll, Roll Your Onigiri in Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma

To start Roll, Roll, Roll Your Onigiri quest in Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma , follow the beach around Summer Shores on the Summer Region map until you reach the small slope near the Open Pavilion Dragon Statue , as pictured on the map above.

On approaching, a cutscene triggers, showing you and Woolby talking to a villager about the strange, singing hole in the ground, followed by the option to roll something inside. Specifically, you'll need to make an Onigiri , and then feed it to the hole, which you can do by selecting the Onigiri recipe in the inventory menu that appears when interacting with the hole.

After feeding the hole Onigiri , you'll get a reward when choosing between a big or little basket and unlocking the Roll, Roll, Roll Your Onigiri quest , categorized as an Azuma side quest in the game. Subsequent Roll, Roll, Roll Your Onigiri spots will then ask for a specific Onigiri recipe.

Big Basket Vs. Little Basket Choice

Unlike other big decisions in Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma , the only difference between choosing the big or little basket is what secondary reward you get at each Onigiri location. If you select the big basket at the Summer Region location that triggers the quest, you'll get Strong Thread , but picking the little basket gives you three pieces of Silver . However, whichever basket you choose, you'll still receive the Butter Roll Recipe as the primary reward (a level 1 cooking recipe made from flour and butter).

At each Roll, Roll, Your Onigiri quest Location, you'll also get the chance to choose from more little and big baskets for your reward, the only difference being which secondary reward you get, as detailed in the table further below.

Roll, Roll, Roll Your Onigiri Quest Locations and Rewards

If you want to complete the entire quest and get all possible rewards, there are five more Roll, Roll, Roll Your Onigiri locations to discover across Azuma. You can find each location by its Onigiri map icon, with each hole requiring a specific Onigiri recipe, as listed below and pictured on the maps above:

  • West of Guardians Grove in the Spring Region - Miso Onigiri.
  • Right of the Western Knoll dragon shrine in the Autumn Region - Salmon Onigiri.
  • Near the pond north of the Underground Wayside Shrine in the Winter Region - Tempura Shrimp Onigiri
  • Near the Dragon Shrine on Dawnbreak Island - Bonito Flake Onigiri
  • On the small island in the Heavenly Realm east of the Heavenly Entrance Dragon Shrine - Greatest Grilled Onigiri . However, you will need to use the Sacred Staff and Sacred Parasol to navigate the waters to reach it. You can obtain the Sacred Staff once you reach The God of the Heavens in Hiding main story quest.

At each location, you'll be asked to choose between a big or little basket as your reward. Ticking off all six Roll, Roll, Roll, Your Onigiri locations completes the quest, giving you Matcha Flan Recipe and Onigiri Replica decoration as your final primary reward. However, you'll get a different secondary reward each time in addition to the same primary reward, depending on whether you choose the big or little basket, with all possible quest rewards detailed in the table below:

Roll, Roll, Roll, Your Onigiri Quest Location

Required Onigiri Recipe

Primary Reward

Big Basket Secondary Reward

Little Basket Secondary Reward

Summer Region (West of Guardians Grove)

Onigiri

  • Butter Roll recipe

  • Strong Thread

  • Silver (x3)

Spring Region

Miso Onigiri

  • Pumpkin Pie recipe
  • Salted Stuffed Mochi recipe

  • Gold

  • Quality Horn

Autumn Region

Salmon Onigiri

  • Cookie recipe
  • Sweet Potato of Ages recipe

  • Mysterious Fur

  • Ruby

Winter Region

Tempura Shrimp Onigiri

  • Hamburg Sandwich recipe
  • Grilled Corn recipe

  • Sapphire

  • Mysterious Fang

Dawnbreak Island (The Forgotten Grove Entrance Dragon Shrine in Spring Skies)

Bonito Flake Onigiri

  • Chocolate Cookies recipe
  • Cheesecake recipe
  • Pumpkin Flan recipe

  • Mysterious Branch

  • Rune Crystal

The Heavenly Realm

Greatest Grilled Onigiri

  • Matcha Flan recipe (restores 1500 HP, 50 RP, plus MND+5).
  • Onigiri Replica (Decoration)

  • Diamond

  • Amethyst

Onigiri Recipes in Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma

There are several Onigiri Recipes you need to make to complete Roll, Roll, Roll Your Onigiri in Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma , which require the following ingredients to make once you've unlocked each recipe:

Onigiri Recipe

Ingredients

Onigiri

  • Steamed Rice

Grilled Onigiri

  • Onigiri
  • Soy Sauce

Bonito Flake Onigiri

  • Onigiri
  • Soy Sauce
  • Preserved Bonito

Miso Onigiri

  • Onigiri
  • Miso

Salmon Onigiri

  • Onigiri
  • Grilled Salmon (cooked from x1 Salmon caught in rivers at Winter Village and x1 Salt)

Tempura Onigiri

  • Onigiri
  • Shrimp Tempura

Tuna Onigiri

  • Onigiri
  • Tuna Salad

Greatest Grilled Onigiri

  • Onigiri
  • Soy Sauce

While most of the above Onigiri recipes are somewhat straightforward to unlock, some are a little trickier to find. To get the Miso Onigiri recipe , you'll need to activate the small frog statue on the group of islands opposite Summer Shores and the Open Pavilion dragon save statue in the Summer Region map . However, to reach the frog statue, you need to use the Sacred Parosol on the wind current, a Sacred Treasure you unlock when reaching Winter Village.

To get the Greatest Grilled Onigiri recipe , you'll need to reach level 6 friendship with Matsuri to unlock the ability to cook together . Afterward, head to Iroha's Teahouse or any Teahouse, then choose the Grilled Onigiri recipe to cook together with Matsuri , which should have a chef's hat icon indicating it leads to a unique recipe . After cooking the Grilled Onigiri recipe with Matsuri, you'll automatically unlock the Greatest Grilled Onigiri recipe, a unique recipe that you can then cook using Onigiri and Soy Sauce.

Although you can cook Onigiri, it's also possible to collect basic Onigiri near shrines across Azuma. Like other recipes in the game, you can cook Onigiri at bonfires in addition to Teahouses. There is also a cooking station to unlock at the main Spring, Summer, Autumn, and Winter Village Shrine once you've fixed the roof.

item.title: 6 Open-World Games Carried By Their Characters
item.description:
Summary

  • Some open-world games may prioritize gameplay over characters, but a strong character cast can elevate the entire experience.
  • Titles like Days Gone , Mafia 3 , and Final Fantasy 15 showcase how memorable characters can make up for lackluster gameplay.
  • Watch Dogs: Legion takes a unique approach by allowing players to recruit and embody any NPC, resulting in personalized and emotional gameplay moments.

When approaching a game, every player has their preferences, yet few would argue that many video games live or die by their characters. At times, memorable or well-fleshed-out characters can even be a saving grace for an otherwise unremarkable video game.

In the realm of open-world games , it's not uncommon for gameplay to come first, with titles sidelining characters or story beats to some degree, instead focusing on providing an enjoyable time through mechanics or activities alone. Some rare open-world games, on the other hand, may not shine too brightly in terms of gameplay or story, yet can feature surprisingly great characters. Spending time with them can be a reward in itself, capable of carrying the entire experience.

Below, we'll take a look at open-world games that primarily shine through their diverse and memorable characters, even if other aspects of the experience may not fully live up to the best in the genre.

1 Days Gone

Deacon St. John, Boozer, And Sarah Whitaker

Days Gone Remastered
22
9.4 /10
Released
April 25, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature: Blood and Gore, Drug Reference, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language
Powered by

By almost any metric, Days Gone is a pretty average zombie open-world game, relying on familiar tropes of the genre and sticking a bit too close to the so-called Ubisoft formula. While the game doesn't try to reinvent the wheel with its gameplay loop or map activities, many players would agree that the character cast is one of its strongest aspects, easily captivating players from start to finish with how relatable and believable they are.

Played by Sam Witwer, the protagonist Deacon St. John, despite constantly crossing paths with other survivors, is mostly consumed with his own goals, which sets him apart from the tired trope of the noble savior. His habit of talking to himself is also much more convincing than in many other games, where protagonists seem to directly address the players. Additionally, Deacon's relationship with his sworn brother, William "Boozer" Gray, shines throughout the entire game as one of the better examples of human friendship when the world around them is collapsing. The supporting cast is also strong, featuring memorable characters and antagonists like Skizzo, Rikki Patel, and Colonel Matthew Garret.

Finally, Days Gone is filled with lengthy flashbacks of Deacon's past life, fleshing out his relationship with his beloved missing wife, Sarah Whitaker. Full of heartwarming and slightly awkward moments that make these interactions feel all the more human, Days Gone 's down-to-earth story and complex characters alone could carry players through the lengthy campaign.

2 Mafia 3

Lincoln Clay, John Donovan, And Father James Ballard

Mafia III
5 /10
8.0 /10
Released
October 7, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Game Experience May Change During Online Play, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

Unlike the first two Mafia games, with their beautiful and authentic open worlds serving only as a backdrop for the stories of Tommy Angelo and Vito Scaletta, Mafia 3 went in the opposite direction, leaning fully into the classic open-world gameplay formula, full of repetitive missions and activities. Yet, like a true Mafia game, Mafia 3 still features a robust cast of memorable characters and a surprisingly strong narrative, even if it doesn't merge well enough with the core gameplay.

Played by Alex Hernandez, who also starred as the protagonist of Mindseye , Mafia 3' s Lincoln Clay is a strong and fitting character for this impactful revenge story, while also allowing the game to explore topics fresh for the franchise, such as racial inequality, civil rights, and the consequences of the Vietnam War. Other characters are no less brilliant, including John Donovan, Sammy Robinson, Sal and Giorgi Marcano, and even returning characters like Vito Scaletta. Adding to the game's spectacular presentation is the pseudo-documentary style of cutscenes, with characters like Father James Ballard and FBI agent Jonathan Maguire often serving as narrators for key story events.

Overall, the array of characters, coupled with strong and stylish presentation, could well be enough for many to stick with Mafia 3 to the very end, especially given how great the key missions in the game are. Fortunately, the creators have seemingly learned their lesson here, with the upcoming Mafia: The Old Country already being teased as a return to the formula of the first two, more story-focused entries. Hopefully, the characters will also be another highlight of the game.

3 Final Fantasy 15

Noctis, Ignis, Gladiolus, And Prompto

Final Fantasy 15
9 /10
8.2 /10
Released
November 9, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Language, Mild Blood, Partial Nudity, Violence
Powered by

There is something about Final Fantasy 15 that can instantly hook players, even those unfamiliar with the series. The prospect of a group of young friends venturing on a road trip is rather underutilized in gaming, and Final Fantasy 15 delivers it almost flawlessly. Despite a somewhat sketchy, empty open world that begs for more interesting and diverse activities, Final Fantasy 15 's lead cast Noctis, Ignis, Gladiolus, and Prompto could be enough to completely captivate some players.

On their journey, the friends constantly chatter during driving, combat, or exploration, while special traits and hobbies, like Ignis' passion for cooking and Prompto's love for taking photos, add tangible, believable character dynamics and that relatable brotherhood flair. Whether staying at camps in the wilderness, discussing how the day has treated them, or collecting memories from the trip, their interactions feel genuine. Initially, Final Fantasy 15 was criticized for being too uneven in its narrative, yet to the developers' credit, much effort was poured into the game after release to improve certain aspects. This includes special DLC episodes for each of the lead characters, allowing fans to explore them more deeply through Episode Ignis , Episode Gladiolus , and Episode Prompto .

In the end, even if Final Fantasy 15 can feel a bit messy in its direction, overshadowing the lighthearted vibes with at times overly dramatic events, almost as if it's unsure what it wants to be, the game's characters remain the heart and soul of the entire experience, exactly as one would expect from the franchise.

4 Mass Effect: Andromeda

The Ryder Family & Their Allies

Mass Effect: Andromeda
8 /10
10
8.4 /10
Released
March 1, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Violence
Powered by

Mass Effect: Andromeda tried something new for the series, attempting to marry BioWare's signature cinematic RPG narrative with open-world planetary environments. While the final result may not be as strong as many had hoped, with repetitive design, too many fetch quests, and unremarkable NPCs, the game remains faithful to the Mass Effect spirit, delivering a brand-new team of memorable space travelers. Even if Ryder's team can't quite match the companions of the original trilogy, the new characters have their charm.

Right from the start, Andromeda differentiates itself from previous games by placing the entire Ryder family in the spotlight, including Alec Ryder and his kids, Sara and Scott, one of whom is destined to become the new Pathfinder. Traditionally, for the series, fans can expect many charismatic allies (and aliens) to join them on their journey. From humans Cora Harper and Liam Costa to turian Vetra Nyx, asari Peebee, krogan Nakmor Drack, and even the new angara Jaal Ama Darav everyone has a special place aboard the Tempest, sharing unique dynamics with other NPCs, dedicated missions (some of the best the game has to offer), or even being a romance option for the protagonist, if players are interested.

Even if Mass Effect: Andromeda hasn't delivered on everything it set out to do, playing more like an average open-world game than a signature BioWare RPG, its characters are strong enough to deserve a sequel that would explore their growth and evolving personalities, just like the original trilogy did.

5 Suicide Squad: Kill The Justice League

Captain Boomerang, Harley Quinn, Deadshot, And King Shark

Suicide Squad: Kill The Justice League
7.0 /10
Released
February 2, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League is one of the biggest disappointments of recent years. Abandoning their traditional strengths in crafting story-driven open-world action-adventures set in the DC Universe, Rocksteady and Warner Bros. opted for a live-service direction with Suicide Squad . This resulted in a rather underwhelming, repetitive gameplay loop, an abrupt campaign without a proper ending, and an underutilized setting of Metropolis. One of the few redeeming qualities of Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League is the Squad itself, filled with bright, memorable personalities and a vivid group dynamic.

True to the studio's core, the main characters Captain Boomerang, Harley Quinn, Deadshot, and King Shark are all well-designed and portrayed, easily making them one of the best renditions of the Suicide Squad to date. Despite the live-service format, Kill the Justice League is full of creative story cutscenes, rich character interactions, and constant banter during intense gameplay. Supporting characters like Amanda Waller, The Flash, and Wonder Woman also stand out, although some key figures, like Batman and Superman, ended up feeling underwhelming, despite being performed by Kevin Conroy and Nolan North, respectively.

Nevertheless, even with some ambiguous plot turns and twists involving iconic DC superheroes, the characters are definitely carrying the experience, serving as one of the main draws to at least finish the story campaign. With all that, it's easy to assume that if Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League had been a condensed, story-driven experience akin to Marvel's Guardians of the Galaxy , it likely would have been received much better.

6 Watch Dogs: Legion

Recruit Unique Specialists & Play As Anyone

Watch Dogs Legion
8 /10
7.6 /10
Released
October 29, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Drug Reference, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

Watch Dogs: Legion is a rather special breed of open-world game, even despite the largely familiar Ubisoft formula. Legion stands out not only due to its rare futuristic setting in a modern city, but even more so because of its approach to characters. Unlike almost every other open-world game, Watch Dogs: Legion doesn't feature a classic fixed protagonist and supporting cast, instead allowing players to play as anyone, searching for, recruiting, and customizing any NPC on London's streets.

This unique system can be an advantage for players open to experimentation, but also a disadvantage for those who prefer well-established and fleshed-out characters, like Aiden Pearce or Marcus Holloway from the first two Watch Dogs games (although some key characters return in DLC). Even with plenty of voice-over lines for every custom NPC, as well as rich combinations of unique perks and traits, the playable characters in Watch Dogs: Legion lack the personality of traditional hand-crafted protagonists. On the bright side, players can embody such unusual characters as elderly people or even play as a magician.

Nevertheless, such an unmatched approach to characters in an open-world game, as well as the freedom to play as anyone, deserves a spotlight, especially given that players may create truly unique characters for their playthrough, which, coupled with permadeath scenarios, can result in deeply personal and emotional moments that simply can't be replicated in any other open-world game.

item.title: October 10 Will Be a Big Day for Little Nightmares Fans
item.description:
Little Nightmares 3 and Little Nightmares Enhanced Edition will both hit the market on October 10, Bandai Namco and Supermassive Games have revealed. Little Nightmares 3 is now available to pre-order in four editions, with every single one of them offering early access to the newly announced enhanced edition of the first series entry.

August 23 will mark the second anniversary of the Little Nightmares 3 announcement, which materialized during Gamescom's Opening Night Live. The third entry in the atmospheric horror series is also the first not developed by Tarsier Studios, a Swedish developer acquired by Embracer Group in December 2019. Although Tarsier created the original titles, it never owned the Little Nightmares IP, which belongs to Bandai Namco. The upcoming installment is instead being made by the Until Dawn developer Supermassive Games.

During the June 24 Little Nightmares Showcase, the third series entry at last received a firm release date: October 10. Little Nightmares 3 will have a same-day release across the latest two generations of PlayStation, Xbox, and Nintendo consoles, as well as PC. Pre-orders are now open across all platforms, with the side-scrolling horror title offered in four editions, ranging from the $39.99 base game to the $119.99 Premium Collector Spiral Edition.

All Little Nightmares 3 Editions

  • Standard Edition ($39.99) : base game + Dark Six Costumes Set (pre-order bonus only)
  • Digital Deluxe Edition ($59.99) : i ncludes the Secrets of The Spiral - Expansion Pass and the Residents Costumes Pack
  • Collector Mirror Edition ($89.99) : adds to the Deluxe edition content, a figurine, a metal case, a physical artbook, the OST in digital and physical format, and some stickers
  • Premium Collector Spiral Edition ($119.99) : exclusive to the Bandai Namco Store which, contains the Collector Mirror Edition figurine, enhanced with a music box base, a Nome controller/phone holder and a double-sided coin of Low and Alone.

Little Nightmares Enhanced Edition Is Real, and Already in Early Access

The previously leaked Enhanced Edition of Little Nightmares has also been officially announced during the June 24 showcase. It is scheduled to launch alongside Little Nightmares 3 on October 10, but early access is already available on the PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC. Access to the Enhanced Edition is granted exclusively to those who pre-order Little Nightmares 3 .

This new and improved version of the game promises ray tracing and volumetric lighting support, among other technical improvements. Gameplay enhancements like refined checkpoint placement and unspecified helpers will be part of the package as well. In addition to its early access platforms, Little Nightmares Enhanced Edition will also launch on the Switch 2.

October 2025 Will Be a Great Month for Horror Fans

Little Nightmares 3 is far from the only new release that may appeal to fans of horror and horror-adjacent games this October. Titles such as Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 , The Kharzov Effect , Confined: Leaving OKB-134 , The Blessing of Airon , Welcome to Doll Town , and Tezcatlipoca are all slated for release in the same time frame and target a similar audience. The same goes for Besmirch , H9 , and Directive 8020 the latter of which even comes from the Little Nightmares 3 developer Supermassive.

item.title: Marvel Rivals: How to Get Magiks Will of Galacta Skin For Free
item.description:
Marvel Rivals continues to expand its roster and cosmetic collections each season, giving players plenty of ways to customize their favorite heroes. Whether it's through completing in-game challenges, progressing through the Battle Pass, participating in special events, or claiming Twitch drops, there are multiple ways to unlock new skins for characters on the roster.

In Season 2.5, a new wave of Twitch drops brings the spotlight to Magik with the next Will of Galacta bundle. This limited-time bundle includes the Will of Galacta skin for Magik, a themed nameplate, a Magik emote, and a spray featuring Galacta. Players can earn all of these items for free via Twitch drops for a limited time. If you find yourself interested in securing these drops, all the information you'll need to do so has been outlined in the guide below.

How to Get Magiks Will of Galacta Skin For Free in Marvel Rivals

The Will of Galacta Magik Twitch drops will be available for Marvel Rivals players to earn and claim from June 19 to July 16, 2025 . To be eligible for these drops, players must first link their Marvel Rivals account with their Twitch account. Once linked, simply watch participating streamers with Twitch Drops enabledthese streams are usually marked with a [ DROPS] tag in the title.After watching these streams for a certain amount of hours, players will earn one reward from the bundle at each milestone. All watch times and rewards have been outlined below.

Marvel Rivals Season 2.5 Twitch Drops

  • Watch for 1 hour: Will of Galacta spray
  • Watch for 2 hours: Will of Galacta Magik nameplate
  • Watch for 4 hours: Magik Echoes of Limbo emote
  • Watch for 8 hours: Will of Galacta Magik skin

How to Link Twitch to Marvel Rivals Account For Drops

  1. Visit the Marvel Rivals website.
  2. On the top right hand corner, click the log in button.
  3. You will now be able to sign in depending on which platform you play on - Steam, PS etc.
  4. Once you are logged in, click on your profile and click Connections .
  5. Now select Twitch and follow the instructions on screen to complete the linking process.

After earning one or more Twitch drops, head over to the Drops section of your Twitch profile and click the "Claim" button for each reward. Once claimed, youll receive an in-game mail in Marvel Rivals for each item, letting you confirm the reward. You will then be able to find and equip these items in your hero gallery.
